Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
@jl777c i was testing rpc libs last week - for the architecture of dapps.
currently
```
[webpage]<------->[local OR remote proxy server]<------->[KMD RPC]
works
```
however
```
[local webpage]<------>[local KMD daemon] 
does not
```
and the reason is web browser has CORS error when talking to local daemon directly.

`geth` (ethereum client) has a command line argument --rpccorsdomain [1]

Would it be possible to add a similar setting in komodod.conf so  komodod will allow web browsers to connect to kmd rpc directly.

It's the CORS pre-flight check which needs support [2].  Browsers automatically send these HTTP OPTIONS requests, which rely on the server side to respond with the cross-origin "access-control-allow-origin" and "access-control-allow-methods" and "access-control-max-age".  Otherwise current dapp architecture i think would be limited to proxy-requests either by sending requests through to an intermediary on the same host as the daemon (could be same machine, but just adds the "backend" to connect to from a web application).

Lots of Info about CORS here [3] in case you're not familiar.

[1] https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/1775
[2] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Preflight_request
[3] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: tl;dr; üëÜ cannot hit KMD RPC directly from browser without CORS pre-flight check responses.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: isnt there some proxy you can use for the local webpage?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am not familiar with CORS, actually familiar with CORS problems that are hard to solve

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: yes, that is the first architecture, using a proxy.   just means unable to write apps directly from the browser for now.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if someone knows how to fix it, I can fix it but I worry about security

Content: @Mylo @pbca26 done the proxy way when he worked with agama

Author: Mylo#8306

Yes cheers @grewalsatinder (and barterdex marshalls similarly) üòÉ

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@jl777c Working on documentation, trying to clarify things.

The following is the current text. It's an example for the `getaddressbalance` method.
```
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddressbalance", "params": [{"addresses": ["12c6DSiU4Rq3P4ZxziKxzrL5LmMBrzjrJX"]}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:7771/
```
This general idea is repeated throughout the documentation.

Is this for executing on a remote server? Or are there circumstances where I would execute this locally?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Is this a leftover from the Zcash documentation?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Also, is there a limit to how many addresses can be requested in `getaddressbalance`?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
> komodo-cli getaddressbalance '{"addresses": ["12c6DSiU4Rq3P4ZxziKxzrL5LmMBrzjrJX"]}'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddressbalance", "params": [{"addresses": ["12c6DSiU4Rq3P4ZxziKxzrL5LmMBrzjrJX"]}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:7771/
```
both are equivalent. But `./komodo-cli` is easier to use while a person is accessing the node through a terminal or using shell scripts.
The curl command can be used both locally or remotely(with the appropriate settings and permissions). The rpc interface is mainly for writing other programs(ex:wallets that need GUI) that access komodod

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Hmm, interesting. I'm about to go to bed. Will need to pick this up again tomorrow.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@gcharang If you want to just scroll through real quick, you can see what I'm working towards. Trying to take into account guidance from @Mylo, too.

https://github.com/siddhartha-komodo/KomodoPlatformDocs/blob/v0.0.1/docs/rebuild/03_Developer_Documentation/02-Komodo/01-Komodo-API.rst
